raw_text: They only used pairs of anaphors and their closest antecedents aspositive examples in training, but evaluated according to Vilain et al (1995) .Cardie and Wagstaff (1999) describe an unsupervised clustering approach to noun phrase co reference resolution in which features are assigned to single noun phrases only
clean_text: Cardie and Wagstaff (1999) describe an unsupervised clustering approach to noun phrase coreference resolution in which features are assigned to single noun phrases only.

citing_paper_authors: Christof E., Müller | Stefan, Rapp | Michael, Strube
raw_text: position (NPs are numbered sequentially)? pronoun type (nom. ,acc., possessive, ambiguous)? article (indefinite, definite, none)? appositive (yes, no)? number (singular, plural)? proper name (yes, no)? semantic class (based on WordNet: time, city, animal, human, object; based on a separate algorithm: number, money, company)? gender (masculine, feminine, either, neuter) ?animacy (anim ,inanim) Table 2: Features used by Cardie and Wagstaff The feature semantic class used by Cardie and Wagstaff (1999) seems to be a domain-dependent one which can only be used for the MUC domain and similar ones
clean_text: The feature semantic class used by Cardie and Wagstaff (1999) seems to be a domain-dependent one which can only be used for the MUC domain and similar ones.

citing_paper_authors: Vincent, Ng | Claire, Cardie
raw_text: Although approaches to co reference resolution that rely only on clustering could easily enforce transitivity (as in Cardie and Wagstaff (1999)), they have not performed as well as state-of-the-art approaches to co reference
clean_text: Although approaches to coreference resolution that rely only on clustering could easily enforce transitivity (as in Cardie and Wagstaff (1999)), they have not performed as well as state-of-the-art approaches to coreference.

citing_paper_authors: Vincent, Ng
raw_text: To expand our set of candidate partitions, we can potentially incorporate more high-performing co reference systems into our framework, which is flexible enough to accommodate even those that adopt knowledge-based (e.g., Harabagiu et al (2001)) and unsupervised approaches (e.g., Cardie and Wagstaff (1999), Bean and Riloff (2004))

clean_text: Coreference resolution on text datasets is well studied (e.g., (Cardie and Wagstaff, 1999)).

citing_paper_authors: Jacob, Eisenstein | Randall, Davis
raw_text: We employ a set of verbal features that is similar to the features used by state-of-the-art co reference resolution systems that operate on text (e.g., (Cardieand Wagstaff, 1999))
clean_text: We employ a set of verbal features that is similar to the features used by state-of-the-art coreference resolution systems that operate on text (e.g., (Cardieand Wagstaff, 1999)).

citing_paper_authors: Jacob, Eisenstein | Randall, Davis
raw_text: NPs were transcribed, roughly half the size of the MUC6development set, which includes 2072 markable NPs over 30 documents. Evaluation metric Coreference resolution is often performed in two phases: a binary classification phase, in which the likelihood of co refer ence for each pair of noun phrases is assessed; and a partitioning phase, in which the clusters of mutually-co referring NPs are formed, maximizing some global criterion (Cardie and Wagstaff, 1999) .Our model does not address the formation of noun phrase clusters, but only the question of whether each pair of noun phrases in the document corefer. Consequently, we evaluate only the binary classification phase, and report results in terms of the area under the ROC curve (AUC)
clean_text: Coreference resolution is often performed in two phases: a binary classification phase, in which the likelihood of coreference for each pair of noun phrases is assessed; and a partitioning phase, in which the clusters of mutually coreferring NPs are formed, maximizing some global criterion (Cardie and Wagstaff, 1999).
